title: rpcdaemon crashes when serving debug_traceTransaction via Websocket
body:
#### System information

Erigon version: `erigon version 2021.07.2-alpha`

OS & Version: Linux

Commit hash : 95ab8506bc3f1b115d1bddb3f8e73c3474e1c7ad (tag: v2021.07.02)

#### Expected behaviour

The rpcdaemon does not crash.

#### Actual behaviour

The rpcdaemon process crash: `panic: runtime error: invalid memory address or nil pointer dereference`
Similar to #2206 but my erigon node does not stuck on block processing, and it is not fixed in latest release. 

#### Steps to reproduce the behaviour

1. start rpcdaemon
2. send RPC call via **websocket**:
```json
{
    "id": 1337,
    "jsonrpc":"2.0",
    "method":"debug_traceTransaction",
    "params": [
        "0x755e9f215ab7d11aedff6c4f82c519aa13414d7653a7f2241de7b388a6771def",
        {
            "disableStorage": false,
            "disableMemory": true,
            "disableStack": false
        }
    ]
}
```

Rpcdaemon works fine with http connection.

#### Backtrace


```

INFO [07-10|16:20:33.763] rpc filters: subscribing to Erigon events

[signal SIGSEGV: segmentation violation code=0x1 addr=0x0 pc=0xb9274e]

goroutine 119 [running]:
```

thank you for reporting
It was fixed in last release (or later), but methods which do streaming of json - can't be used by websocket. 
https://github.com/ledgerwatch/erigon/issues/2269
